inn1.comm: strays down the leg-side first-up, and that's the first run of the day. Hint of movement
better line and length, angling across the left-hander, but a firm clip through midwicket brings the first runs off the bat
zippy pace, nips back off the seam and good carry too. Prior shoulders arms with a flourish
outside off, and left alone. Disciplined stuff
fenced at that one, good bowling. A foot outside off but the extra bounce tempted a bit of a nibble
great delivery, held its line and fizzed past the edge. Prior is anxious to get bat on ball
bit more width but again some late movement off the seam. Prior leaves well alone and that's an encouraging first over
right on the money first up, maybe kept a fraction low as Cook defended with a dead bat in front of off stump
a touch of width, and fenced down to third man
another hurried defensive stroke, and Prior hustles Cook through for a quick single
good line and length again, defended uneasily back down the pitch
lift off a good length, but angled into the hip and turned away to square leg
fuller and straighter, driven but not timed. Excellent probing over
strays down leg again
full length and angled all the way across Cook's bows. He chases the perceived width but doesn't quite get the edge
on leg stump, clipped to midwicket
tries to clip through square leg again, but the ball bobbles at Cook's feet
good line and length, healthy pace, Cook comes forward watchfully and smothers the ball
tighter to middle-and-leg, angled across, defended
excellent over once again. Cook can only defend this last delivery on off stump
excellent pace - rears up at the splice of Prior's bat, who does well to drop the ball at his feet.
touch of width, steered down to third man
lovely ball, full length outside off stump, angled across Cook as well, just beats the edge of a tentative bat
shorter and Cook cuts, but without any conviction. A scampered single off an under-edged shot
steered down to third man, good pace once again
tidy completion to the over, defended back down the pitch
full length and tailing back into the stumps. Hint of late swing and Prior misses with a swish
defensive once again. England content to ride the conditions for the moment
curves into the pads, a deflection seems to rear into Prior's visor, but no alarms
full length again, but this time defended with more intent. A big stride and a firm push. Doesn't find the gap, but maybe he's finding his timing
just back of a length, prodded out to point
outside off, and left alone to complete a very tidy maiden over
90mph once again, and half an appeal as that one pitches outside leg
full and straight again, Cook tries to clip that one off his toes, but can't time it
perfect. Lands on the seam and zips past the edge by a fraction of a splinter. England are being made to struggle
pushed out to cover
that's an uncomfortable shot. Cook's feet were rooted to the crease, and a loose waft outside off. Powell using the slope to perfection
superb finish, full and brisk and Cook can but defend that into the crease
the shot of a frustrated man. A big swish and a miss from Prior, and a grin from his tormentor, Rampaul
advances down the pitch, and a single clipped through midwicket
lovely line once again, zips past the back, taken with a leap in Ramdin's midriff
a premeditated flinch from Cook, followed by a firm swing of a pull shot. But not timed once again, and fielded at deep backward square
big appeal for caught-behind, but Nigel Llong immediately indicates that clipped the pad as Prior hurtled down the pitch
elegant strike, but ineffective as cover intercepts a full-flowing drive. Another lovely over
the first genuinely loose delivery from Powell - short, wide, asking to be hit, and that lands six inches inside the rope at deep point
good response. Immediately tightens his line and zips past the edge again
width again, but less of it this time. A bottom-edged cut gives Ramdin a bit of a flutter as he changes direction to field behind the stumps
firm strike off the back foot, but can't pick the gap. Nice shot but no way through the field
beautiful bowling again, bursts past the edge and straight through to the keeper
shorter in length, but excellent line again. Straight through to the keeper at a good height
hurried again, but defended out to point
two steps down the pitch and a quick single, steered to midwicket
short and Cook goes after it, but he's cramped for room and a top-edge just loops out of reach of midwicket. England are getting frustrated and taking a few chances
full and straight again, clipped to midwicket
dancing footwork again, but this drive dribbles out to cover
advances down the pitch again, but can't connect with a smear over midwicket. The ball raps the pad and rolls into the off side
short and onto Cook quickly. His attempted pull takes an under-edge and just misses the stumps. It ain't easy out there
that's the shot he's been looking for. Just a fraction of width, Cook hangs back in the crease and creams that through the covers off the back foot. Good shot
more positive intent, but can't beat cover this time
good delivery, keeps a touch low as it eludes the edge and Ramdin fields on the bounce
much better carry this time. This one seams back, inside Cook's attempted drive. Misses the stumps by a whisker
much more composed shot this time. Fuller and straighter, and clipped to the edge of the rope at deep midwicket
full and straight, met with a straight bat and a checked drive back down the ground
shuffles across the crease and turned to short midwicket
full and straight again, defended in front of off stump, and a quick single
there it is at last, Prior's first boundary and it's a fine flowing drive through the covers. Just a bit too much width
more attacking intent, but this time Prior can't connect properly with his pull shot
zeroes in on the blockhole, and met with a firm push out to cover
tight line and length yet again, met with a firm push to mid-off
short and cut firmly, but again Cook can't beat the field. He does get a single as the ball bobbles off Dwayne Smith at backward point
didn't quite get hold of it, but two more precious runs from a pull to deep midwicket
full and tailing towards the slips, and a good squirted steer through backward point. Nice timing
a fraction shorter and angled into the thigh pad, a scampered single
firm push into the covers and good running. A more productive over for England
pushed out to midwicket
angled onto the pads again, clipped to midwicket again
third time lucky for Cook. On the pads again, and this time it rockets straight off the middle of the bat. Not a slog in sight. Measured batting
a mix-up, and Prior had given that up for dead as he hurtled down in search of a quick single. Rampaul had two stumps to aim at at short midwicket, but missed. A let-off
slower ball, clipped off the pads to backward square
faster and fuller, defended on off stump
decent line, length and pace to start. Prior drives watchfully into the covers
tight to off stump, at 87mph as well. Not top speed yet, but accurate

that's the breakthrough! Short and nasty late lift, Cook was rushed into the pull shot and a steepling top-edge could have been taken by any of three men converging at short backward square. Bravo took responsibility, and made no mistake
short and straight, Bell sways out of line
angled into the pads, and Bell keeps the strike
another mix-up, and again it was Prior backing up too far that caused the problem. Bell sent him back after a steer to point, but this time Prior would have been safe
outside off, left alone
lovely strike. Smith is too slow to be inaccurate, and Bell latched onto one that drifted onto the pads, and it hurtled down the slope to the fence
better line and length, respectfully treated
on off stump once again. Pushed back down the track
too much room on the off side this time. A wide half-volley and Bell puts that away with aplomb
top delivery, extra bounce for Edwards as this one lifts off the surface past Prior's edge
played from the crease, from the top of the bounce and back down to the pitch
shoulders arms and the ball carries nicely to Ramdin
squeezed off a think inside half of the bat into the gap at midwicket
flings in another bounce, which climbs high and handsomely past Prior and was incredibly close to being a wide...Edwards a lucky boy
drifts onto middle and Prior flicks elegantly through square leg for a couple
pitched up from Smith and takes a thick edge down to fine leg

nearly another mix-up...Prior drops the ball into the off side and wants the single but Bell doesn't agree and for the third time today would have been left stranded if Bravo had been able to collect the ball cleanly
dropped into the leg side, comfortable run this time
plays with soft hands and drops it down by his feet, they agree on the quick single and make it with time to spare
Prior living on the edge with his running, again played into the off side and calls Bell through, who has to dive to make his ground as the throw is well wide of the stumps
quick full toss on leg stump is dispatched with ease through midwicket by Prior, who has battled hard through the early conditions and now wants to fill his boots
hits 90mph but drifts down the leg side and the umpire stretches out his arms
inside edge into the pad, falls into the off side and both batsmen agree on the run with few alarms
pushed into the on side, placed well in front of mid on to keep the strike rotating
uses the pace nicely, flicks off his hip down to fine leg...looks for the second but it's a strong throw from the deep
that's a wide in any cricket...it barely landed on the cut strip and Ramdin was forced to dive across first slip to take it
much tighter to the off stump, Bell watches it go through
beauty, pitched on off stump and seamed away, drawing Bell into a defensive prod which nearly takes the edge
worked past square leg and well fielded by Bravo to keep it to one
Bell is squared up slightly as the delivery straightens off the pitch, but defends into the off side
angled into the off side, the judgment between these two is becoming better after the early alarms
full on middle and worked down the on side of the pitch, Powell slips in his follow through but gets up okay
forced square on the off side from the back foot
spearing in towards middle, Prior digs the ball out well, timing it impressively but picks out mid off
guided over the slip cordon, travels in the air a long way towards third man who makes a tumbling save on the rope to prevent a boundary
this one is played along the floor down to the third man and good running brings Bell back for two...there's nothing wrong with his groin now
well bowled, climbs off a length over the off stump as Bell raises his bat high out of the way the stares down Edwards
whipped of his pads, through square leg and there's a comfortable brace for Bell who is ticking along nicely at the moment
outside off stump, plenty of pace of Edwards, and Bell isn't at all interested
Bell brings out a touch of the limbo as he sways back to avoid another bouncer which is heading towards his chest...well bowled, another hostile over from Edwards
hits the spot first up, Prior defends back to Smith
tucked into the leg side, easy run on offer
Bell doesn't connect cleanly and can't find in the on side
this time he turns it slightly more square and jogs through for another single
very full from Smith, Prior drives with power but straight back to the bowler who parries it in his follow through
again the on side is profitable for these two as Prior picks off a loose delivery through midwicket
another short one from Edwards, Bell lowers his bat and gloves as he zooms through to Ramdin
uses the extra pace from Edwards to guide the ball down to third man
very sensible batting from Prior, waits for the ball and deflects it backward of point...this isn't his usual style of play but just what England needed today
too straight from Edwards, easy pickings for Bell who flicks past square leg with sweet timing...nearly reaches the boundary, but long leg makes it just in time and keeps them to three
bounces towards Priors hip, who can't quite time it as well as Bell on the previous ball and takes the single
third man is kept busy as Bell angles the ball away, sensible one-day cricket from England...but that isn't something that has always come easily in recent times
plays and misses at a cut, well taken by Ramdin standing up to the stumps
driven firmly, on the walk, one bounce back to Smith
finds the gap this time, brings Prior back into strike
pushed to midwicket, no chance of a run
forced out to deep cover, Gayle has started to put some sweepers back now
picks out backward point, who makes a sharp diving save to prevent any runs
floated onto middle, worked down the pitch and Samuels fields
knocked up to long on, simple really
Bell guides down to short third man, who fumbles but it stays at a single
this time straight to short third-man
turned to midwicket, but can't find the gap
picks out deep midwicket this time, so Prior keeps the strike
inside edge into the pads, can't get a single

the breakthrough for West Indies, and it's the golden arm of Dwayne Smith that does it again. A full delivery on middle, Prior plays across the line and is struck on the pad. Nigel Llong is quick to raise his finger and a one-day innings from Prior again stalls in the 30s again. Replays show the ball would have clipped leg stump
Pietersen lets his first ball go through to Ramdin
and his second...at least he has a solid base to start from
onto the front foot, blocked back to Smith
drifts onto the leg stump, Pietersen uses his strong wrists to flick out to deep square-leg and opens his account
gentle medium pace, Pietersen pats it back to the bowler...gentle all round actually, how nice
immense bottom-hand power from Pietersen, flicks this from middle and off stump through midwicket and it pulls up just short of the boundary
hint of away swing for Bravo, Bell still happy to let the ball go
angles this through the slip area, down to third man who is quick enough to keep them to a single
driven with power and flair, but straight at short extra-cover who gets down in time to prevent it shooting across the outfield
punched from the crease out to the sweeper at deep cover
the delivery holds its line and takes the edge, but Pietersen was always in control of the shot and played with soft hands down to third man
rolls his wrists and sends the ball down to long leg for brace
just a touch too wide from Smith, Bell lets it go and the umpire doesn't let the bowler get away with it
neatly driven down to long off
worked off the pads out to deep backward square-leg, nothing ever looks much effort for Bell

huge moment of luck for Pietersen, goes for an expansive drive and Ramdin has little chance to take the inside edge while he is standing up to the stumps...can't really call it a drop, but Pietersen could easily have dragged into his stumps as well
comfortably defended back down the pitch
guided very fine by Pietersen, superb deft touch, but third man is quick out of the blocks
punched to mid on
third man doesn't have much time to relax, Bell picks him out with another glide and another single
dabbled into the off side, splits backward point and cover for an easy run
played into the on side, Bravo - sore ankle and all - is quickly across to complete the fielding
tight line, on off stump, Bell is all defence
forced square with plenty of flourish by Pietersen, but not quite perfect timing, out towards deep point and third man runs around
can't find the gap this time
straight back to Smith
way down the leg side, big wide
driven to mid on, Pietersen having to work hard for all his runs
picks out the gap at midwicket, the fielder on the rope keeps it to one
takes the pad, fine past the keeper, and the ball doesn't have much pace on it which means Bell scampers back for two
welcome relief for Pietersen, slightly off line down the leg side, and a fine leg-glance takes it quickly to the boundary...England's first for 12 overs and a classy shot from KP
picks out the infield on the on side
dropped into the on side, Pietersen wants one but realises it's not on
crunched straight to mid on, a foot either side and that would have been four more...Bravo takes a tumble but is alright
driven to backward point, Pietersen not holding back with his shots
played on the up, square through the off side out to the man on the cover fence
leg-stump and whipped away to the deep. Plenty intent in that shot
width, and driven hard. But not quite timed
tight to the stumps, angled in from off to middle, steered to midwicket
a firm slap past a sprawling cover, still not quite timed though. Smith varying his pace well
angled into the pads, a yelp of an appeal as Pietersen misses his flick. But not out
big stride and pushed firmly down to long-on. England still content to tick along

great fielding from Edwards, hurtling across in his followthrough as Pietersen squirts one into the leg-side - one-handed pick-up-and-throw from a short-leg position. Bell would have been run out if that had hit
outside off stump, fizzes through. Good bowling
short, and pushed back down into the pitch
width, and steered into the gap
short, and Pietersen sways out of line. Edwards grimaces in his followthrough. Ankle trouble?
short again, Pietersen rolls his wrists on a controlled pull to deep midwicket
full and angled into the legs, driven out to midwicket with a full face of the bat
squirted down to third man, another single to keep things ticking
one more to the total, turned behind square
whipped off the pads again. Useful unflustered momentum for England
another cross-court forehand from Pietersen, intercepted at midwicket
midwicket fields again. Good control being exercised
pitched up on leg stump, pushed out to mid-on
just back of a length, Bell defends into his crease and thinks about a single. Nothing doing there
pummelled out to deep point off the back foot, but no way through
almost out twice there! Big appeal for lbw, then a tight squeeze as Pietersen backflipped into his crease as the shy came in from point. Would have been not out on both counts though
just back of a length. Nothing on offer there
wicket-to-wicket delivery, aimed at the top of off, Pietersen nurdles that to third man, and that's drinks. What a splendid idea
pushed out to cover
right up in the blockhole, pushed back to the bowler
good bowling again, Bell can only whip this off middle for another single
bit of room, but Pietersen can't beat the cover ring
Lord's is like a morgue today. One boundary in the last 17 overs, and Pietersen's been there for 41 minutes
turned round the corner, and that's the end of an excellent spell. Just 41 runs in ten overs, and eight of those came in two shots in his first over
right on the spot, outside off, hint of tweak
Pietersen comes to meet that one, but its so so slow, and he has to wait to turn it to midwicket
finds the single on the leg-side this time
nudged down to third man
agonisingly slow turn again. Pietersen tries to apply some oomph through midwicket but its as if the ball never arrives
down to backward point, and that's an excellent first over back
measured drive out to the cover sweeper
floated onto a driveable length outside off, Bell takes the aerial route and chips it over the infield to long-off
a firmer slash outside off, picked up in the deep again
back of a length, wicket-to-wicket delivery, pushed off the line of middle stump to mid-on
Pietersen itching to get on with things, but Bravo unfazed by some horseplay at the crease, and produces a good yorker
got him, and that's a huge moment for West Indies! Pietersen was bound to go for it sooner or later - he went for it sooner, slashing a wild drive to Samuels leaping above his head at backward point.
turned out to midwicket
pushed to backward point
slow, slow looping delivery, and teasing turn. Shah defends
defensive again. Nothing to work with here
pushed down in the crease
44mph that last delivery, with is almost too slow to reach the batsman. Shah plays an uncomfortable late shovel to midwicket

superb slower ball, and that has deceived absolutely everyone. Passed Shah on the full toss, shaved the off stump, and passed through Ramdin's legs for a welcome boundary. England's first since the 30th over
defended. Shah still playing himself in
wicket-to-wicket. Defended again
onto the front foot, and a sloppy piece of fielding by Chanderpaul at cover gifts a single and brought Bell onto strike
attempted yorker, and a stifled appeal as this one swings down leg. Well bowled again
clipped out to square leg
shorter this time, and carved to the cover sweeper
good fielding in the deep from Dwayne Smith, and that ripple of applause is the most animated this crowd has been all innings
thumped into the deep, and a collision mid-pitch as Bell is caught ball-watching
Shah finds the gap at last
starts on leg stump and Bell flicks him fine down to long leg, puts pressure on the fielder and makes it back for two
glides down to third man and more excellent running between Bell and Shah brings two, which takes Bell to a grafting half-century off 70 balls
flicked to midwicket

it's all happening...handsome flowing drive from Bell that finds the gap at cover and races out towards the boundary, a brilliant piece of work from long off makes the save and a strong throw means Bell has to dive for his ground. The third umpire is called for and Bell is home by a few inches, the extra time it took Smith to take the ball and break the stumps
dropped into the leg side and these two appear to have a good understanding over the singles
well placed from Bell, flicked through midwicket and deep square-leg can't stop them coming back for two
Shah backs away and tries to force through the covers, but finds the man on the edge of the ring
turned to midwicket
short and helped round the corner by Bell out to deep square-leg
Shah uses his feet, plays straight to cover
tickled down through short fine-leg, good job he hit that because he was right in front of all three stumps

well, that was on the cards to be honest. Shah slaps it hard to Gayle on the edge of the circle at cover and Bell has already raced up the pitch for a single...Gayle just has to lob the ball towards Samuels at the stumps and Bell is out by half a pitch. So much for these two running well together
Collingwood watches his first ball go past
dropped into the leg side and Collingwood is up and running
flicked off the toes down to long leg, this time the running works and they make it back for two
moves across the stumps and shuffles this one out to deep square-leg
Collingwood uses his feet, but the ball is short of a length and he can only fend it backward of square on the leg side
fuller this time and flicked to midwicket
Collingwood gives himself room and carves to backward point, no chance of a run as Chanderpaul does the fielding
again moves to leg and fends down to third man where some lazy fielding allows Collingwood back for two
goes for the inswinging yorker, heading past leg stump and Collingwood digs it out down to long on
well bowled, back of a length and still a hint of movement. Shah can't force it away
Shah jumps across his crease to a delivery that is well wide of off stump and pops the ball into the leg side

that's comprehensive, Collingwood gives himself room and doesn't make contact, which leaves his stumps exposed and Edwards is straight enough to take advantage. Big wicket for West Indies as England lose their way
pushed to midwicket, nearly a mix-up but Mascarenhas makes it back easily enough
finally a boundary, and some innovation as Shah predicts the short ball and shovels it backward of square...first boundary off the bat since the 30th over
quick single to mid on
beaten all ends up, still assistance for the bowlers which will please the England attack
big appeal, Mascarenhas taken on the boot but it's going down leg and Powell attempts an amusing throw with his left (wrong) arm
off the mark, driven down to long on
back of a length, defended to cover
latches onto the pull, but only gets a single to deep backward-square...Edwards hit 91mph with that ball
very loose from Edwards, misdirected yorker and it's speared down the leg side
glanced very fine, races away past Ramdin for a valuable boundary...the extra pace of Edwards helping
pushed towards point, easy single
quick and targeting leg stump, Mascarenhas digs it out but finds Gayle at cover

cleaned up again, Edwards keeping it simple and effective. Slightly short of yorker length but Mascarenhas had already decided to open his shoulders and didn't make contact. The value of having a strike bowler is showing here
some power in that shot, only a hint of width but Shah cracks the cut shot away with immense force and nobody moved as it raced to the point fence
attempted yorker, dug out towards midwicket to bring Plunkett onto strike
Plunkett frees his arms and slashes down to third man
Shah tries to bring out the sweep/paddle but doesn't back contact and the ball bobbles into the leg side
uses his feet and slaps towards cover, where Chanderpaul can't quite make the save and they come back for two
struck back over the bowler's head, down to long off who keeps it to a single
full and straight, Plunkett can't get it away

another one for Edwards, the short ball does the damage this time as Plunkett gets a thin top edge as tries to launch into a pull. Ramdin takes the catch with ease and it's deserved reward for Edwards
and doesn't get within a country mile of an expansive drive...Edwards has been given a slip too, in the 48th over
quick and short "welcome to the crease" and a few words (or just a few stares, maybe) after Broad had ducked under the bouncer...great cricket

brilliant from Fidel, 94mph, regulation outside through to Ramdin hands Edwards his fifth wicket and it only took him three balls to rough up Broad and give him another lesson in international cricket
very full and Panesar jabs down on it, sending the ball one bounce to cover
Panesar fishes outside off stump, misses, and Edwards completes an outstanding spell of varied pace bowling
carved out through cover, makes it back for two to keep the strike
takes the pad, down to short fine-leg...Monty's turn
clubbed towards cover to bring Shah back on strike, huge amount of effort for not much result but England will be happy
Shah tries to sweep, doesn't make contact and it whizzes past leg stump and is called a wide...tough call
lashed out to deep cover, can't make it back this time
swing and a miss from Panesar, at least he's trying

another one goes, Panesar swings across the line and is taken on the boot by a very full delivery and that was heading straight for middle stump...this has been a fairly horrendous demise from England, but is anyone really that surprised?
outside leg stump and Shah clips it down to fine leg, good start to the last over
slower ball, picked by Shah and launched towards long on, one bounce to the fielder and good running from Anderson makes two possible to keep Shah on strike
heaved down to long on, almost on one knee, and more quick running brings two although the fielding wasn't great from West Indies...vital runs
steps to the leg side, finds the middle but slaps straight to mid off who's in the circle
all over, Anderson has a waft without making contact, Ramdin takes the ball and is already walking in so when Shah tries to steal the bye it's an easy throw and Shah is well short

inn2.comm: good line and length to start the proceedings. Gayle leaves well alone
slightly shorter in length, Gayle climbs into a cut, but can't time it
six inches outside off, angling across the left-hander, left alone
good ball, nips away down the slope. Gayle thinks about a shot, but pulls out
fuller length, up in Gayle's slot, but his drive picks out cover
full length and driven, but mid-off fields comfortably. A maiden to start things off
a beauty! Straight, and climbing at the edge. Flew away to third man through the vacant third slip
starts on leg and straightens. Defended
short, and slams into the pitch. Good lift so far this over as Gayle defends off the back foot
massive appeal, but umpire Llong is not interested. Rightly so, as that pitched outside leg. Would have demolished all three stumps though. Good bowling
just back of a length, defended with a straight bat
full and swinging away, and that's a bit village all round. A massive smear into the leg-side, and a poor piece of fielding from Panesar at midwicket who lets the ball through his legs
full and drilled through the covers. It was in the air all the way, but Gayle picked the gap nicely for his first boundary
good riposte, zips through to the keeper
a stand-and-deliver swat, but not properly connected
tailing away towards the slips, Gayle follows the swing and steers to point off the back foot
cuts down the slope off a good length - it looked for an instant as if there was an edge, but nothing doing
pushed into the covers for a quick single. And another tidy over goes by

Gayle can't believe what he has done. A loose delivery on his hip - it might have been called wide if he hadn't connected. But instead he connected too well, and picked out Stuart Broad at deep backward square
outside off stump, left alone
angled into the toes, takes the pad and slips away
short, and a slappable length. But Morton restrains himself for now
turned down to fine leg, aggressive running brings a third, but it's a tight squeak
banged in, fizzes through. Morton practises an uppercut after it has gone by
left alone outside off stump. 90.7mph that delivery, apparently. Hard to believe
no doubt about that delivery though! Full, fast, hits the seam and zips down the slope and through the gate. Lovely bowling, and now West Indies are in trouble
now it's big, big trouble. Anderson banged one in, Samuels misjudged the bounce, and didn't drop his gloves low enough. Prior completes the catch, and Anderson is on a hat-trick!
couldn't have done much better. Good line, good length, but Chanderpaul has batted too long this summer to be fazed by the situation
right on the spot again. A double-wicket maiden

insane cricket from West Indies, and they are four-down! Smith fenced loosely through the vacant gully, straight down to Anderson at third man whose flat throw was gathered smartly by Prior, and Smith - seeking a second run - is gone without even recourse to the third umpire
two slips and a gully for Bravo, as this one zips past the off stump
Plunkett strays for once onto the pads, and Anderson - diving round the rope - can't quite keep it in play
strays down leg, but no wide called, to Chanderpaul's bemusement
pushed out to midwicket
lovely teasing bowling, Anderson zips that one down the slope again, and Chanderpaul chases it outside off stump
outside off again, more confidently left alone this time
short, and tucked off the hip to Panesar at backward square
beautiful bowling, climbs off the seam, across Chanderpaul's bows and through to the keeper
wider this time, and a tumbling stop from Prior
another lovely over. Incidentally, since that rain-break in England's innings, 10 wickets have fallen in 14.2 overs
good wheels, as they say, outside off stump
turned off the hip to square leg
nips off the seam, raps the pad but never a danger of a shout
fuller length, six inches outside off. Met with a straight bat
pushed into the gap in the covers
drawn onto the front foot, defended into the covers
another ripper, even Chanderpaul is being made to look all at sea by this line and seaming length
wider, left alone
pushed firmly into the covers, partially stopped by a diving Broad
right on the spot again and shaping away, Anderson is using the slope supremely
middle-and-leg, angled across, defended
turned to leg to complete another superb over
big booming drive - Bravo really threw the sink at that, and effectively so. Not such a bad delivery, but too full
better length, defended this time
drawn forward, pushed out to cover
strays onto the pads, a scampered single
on leg stump and defended
that's the end of the first Powerplay, and what a ten overs it has been for England
Bravo drawn forward by a full ball outside off stump, the inside edge is squeezed into the leg side
played from the crease with a straight bat down to mid on
too much width on this one and Bravo launches into a powerful square drive, welcome relief for West Indies
goes leg side this time, on middle and Bravo leans into a sweet flick which flies through midwicket
Anderson tightens up, on off stump and Bravo defends at the top of the bounce
ooh, that's very wide down the leg side...Anderson has lost it a little in this over
that's better, fuller and outside off stump, Bravo covers up with a big stride but doesn't play it with complete conviction
top edge from Chanderpaul flies high over the keeper and down to the boundary, Stuart Broad makes a valiant dive but can't quite do enough to stop four
outside off stump, shoulders arms and watches it sail through to Prior
same again from Chanderpaul, he's used to pulling West Indies out of a hole
and it's the slip which fields this one as Chanderpaul chops the ball hard into the ground and it bounces towards Owais Shah
played off the front foot with a turn of the wrists into the leg side, comfortable single
the ball was on off stump, but Bravo works it through midwicket and the deep fielder does the tidying up
full and brings Chanderpaul into a drive which locates Alastair Cook at cover
dropped into the off side and a well-judged run keeps the scoreboard moving
tight line from Broad, Bravo plays into the off side and can't get a single
drifts into the legs and takes the pad all the way down to the fine-leg fence...releases a touch of pressure and brings up West Indies' 50
better line, pushed into the covers and they make the run before Collingwood's shy comes flying in
rare loose shot from Chanderpaul, misses an attempted pull
jumps to play a bouncing delivery and gets a run to the vacant square-leg area
pushed to backward point
short and pulled away with power by Chanderpaul, he picked the length quickly and dispatched it
doesn't play at this as Plunkett fires it wide outside off
short on leg stump, deflected down to fine leg off the body
flicked to midwicket, nothing on offer
Chanderpaul rides the bounce from Broad and guides this down to third man
more extras to the total, angling into the pads and takes the thigh inches wide of Prior...fifty stand off 56 balls and West Indies are still fighting
guided down to third man, rotating the strike is important with a left and right hander at the crease
on off stump, Chanderpaul comes forward and plays carefully to cover
in typical style, Chanderpaul shuffles across his crease and defends to cover
thick inside edge into the pad, dribbles to square leg and Chanderpaul wants the single but is, wisely, sent back by Bravo
starts on leg stump and the shuffle to fine leg is well fielded by Anderson to keep West Indies to one
played late down to third man
Bravo plays from the crease out into the covers
takes the outside edge down to third man, but played with soft hands
sweetly driven through the covers but Pietersen does the sweeping on the fence
drifts again, clips the pad and races away fine but Anderson makes good ground and a sliding save keeps them to three
driven with an open blade down to third man and Bravo is quick to notice it's Panesar down there and rushes back for two
that's the breakthrough England wanted, Broad finds the right spot outside off stump, hint of seam movement as Bravo lunges forward and the regulation edge goes through to Prior
his first ball is right on mark, full at the stumps and Ramdin defends carefully to mid on to loud screams of approval from the England fielders
and that's the end of that...pitched outside off stump, nips back into Ramdin and keeps a fraction low before clattering into off stump. Broad has two in the over and England are jumping again
this one again shapes into Smith, but he covers up with a solid defensive shot
again very watchful, gets behind it, another eventful over
punched towards mid off
top shot, just a hint of width and Chanderpaul finds the gap between backward point and cover
fuller from Mascarenhas, played back down the pitch
tucked off middle, down to long leg where Broad fields
Smith comes forward with a very correct defensive shot
outside off and Smith makes the late decision to leave alone
outside off stump, Chanderpaul lets it go
probing line from Broad and another watchful leave
cut away past backward point and Mascarenhas pulls off an impressive piece of fielding running round from third man and, in one movement, returns it to the keeper
turned around the corner, down to long leg, where Monty gets huge cheers for a solid piece of work
Smith moves across to off stump and works into the leg side
a flat-footed drive takes the inside edge which scoots out to backward square
good lines from Mascarenhas, what he does for Hampshire, and Smith defends to cover
turned to mid on where Monty is in like, well, Monty
angled past the lone slip down to third man
very full and that's some amazing timing from Chanderpaul as it races straight down the ground...it was no more than a push
tries to hit this a little harder and doesn't get much on the ball
driven to mid off
firmly punched from the top of the bounce by Smith but straight at mid off
there's Smith's impatience, a fraction short from Broad and Smith can't resist but doesn't connect with the pull and the ball goes through to Prior
more movement back into Smith, who takes one hand off the bat as he plays to mid on
low full toss and Smith gets it away past mid on for his first boundary, that was a gimme from Broad
pushes this one down the leg side and that's too wide

another for Broad...more big movement back down the Lord's slope, the ball takes the bottom/inside edge of Smith's limp waft and carries through to Prior. Broad's third wicket and that should seal the result for England
short, outside off stump and left alone
tucked out to deep square leg
tries to dab this past slip, risky but gets away with it
lunges forward, inside edge rolls past leg stump
placed into the covers, comfortable single with two balls left in the over
dropped Chanderpaul goes for the cut, gets a big top edge and Prior can't take the tough chance
worked off the pads down to fine leg with enough placement to keep the strike
played out to backward point
flicked to midwicket, sharp work from Pietersen
beats backward point this time so it's over to Powell again
little too wide from Broad, allows Powell to let it go
beauty, pitched on off stump and moved up the slope...brilliant stuff and Powell had no chance playing that
gets bat on this one, back to Broad
low full toss, worked down to long on and brings the 100 up - it's been hard work
it didn't take long, Powell plants his front foot on the crease and plays round a delivery which pitched and straightened from Panesar, no doubt that was taking middle and leg
outside off stump, Rampaul comes forward and defends
thick outside past slip, down towards third man for a couple
defended again with bat and pad together
slightly shorter and pushed into the covers, England won't mind Rampaul keeping the strike
defended to mid on
driven square past backward point and third man collects
pushed to cover, Chanderpaul left in another hopeless position
picks out Collingwood at cover once again
three in a row for the Chanderpaul-Collingwood combo
defended to point, can't the single and another tight over from Broad
slow turn into Rampaul, pushed to short midwicket
dropped sharp turn this time, takes the edge through to Prior as his second chance goes down off Panesar...again not easy
worked out to deep square leg
finds the gap at square leg with good wrist work
very full, plenty of flight, and Rampaul digs it out back to Panesar
flighted again, Rampaul has a dip this time and swings over midwicket with a slog-sweep
short ball is pulled down to fine leg
bit of a waste, on leg stump and comfortably flicked to long leg by Rampaul...however if he'd missed it leg stump was in danger with a hint of reverse swing
angled to backward point
zips past Chanderpaul's edge...and it takes a good ball to do that
and again from Anderson, Chanderpaul tries to pull his bat inside the line but he clearly played at it
driven on the bounce to Collingwood at cover
a little short from Panesar, pushed to mid on
sharp spin into the batsman, who gets in tangle in the crease and there's a big appeal but it hit the pad outside the line of off stump
tosses this up and Rampaul takes the invite, slotting it down the ground for a handsome boundary
pushed to backward point, a little flatter
this scoots through fairly low, not bouncing much out of the footmarks
turned into the leg side, Rampaul keeps the strike
pace and bounce, too good for Rampaul as he prods outside off stump
flashes down to third man
drop and run from Chanderpaul, into the off side and England won't mind that too much
blocked into the covers, plenty behind it and he looks better than one or two we've seen this season with the bat
proves everything wrong with loose drive outside off stump
again Rampaul keeps the strike as he squirts past backward point down to third man
gentle medium pace is driven to mid off
played off the back foot to backward point
outside off stump, Rampaul has a prod and misses
on middle, Rampaul comes forward and defends off the inside half of the bat to the leg side
top shot, overpitched outside off stump and driven powerful past mid off
defended with ease into the covers...it's all gone very quiet
starts way down the leg side
that's a rarity, a play and miss from Chanderpaul as he fails to connect with a cut
worked down to long leg as Plunkett gets too straight
oh dear, that's a shocker, an attempted bouncer from Plunkett goes all wrong as he lands somewhere near his feet and loops horribly down the leg side
better, at Rampaul's body and gets him a bit of a tangle trying to defend
onto the front foot, into the covers
driven to cover where Pietersen completes the work
neatly clipped off his hip to deep square-leg and again keeps the bowling, this guy needs to bat higher
comes forward and defends
sweeps without making contact and dribbles to short fine-leg
turned to deep square-leg, wants two but they stay at a single
half an appeal from Panesar, but Chanderpaul is outside the line and might have hit it too...apart from that
squeezed into the off side
expansive drive into the covers, but doesn't go very far and that's drinks
pushed back to Plunkett
flicked off leg stump out to deep square-leg, we've seen plenty of that this summer
wild drive from Rampaul and doesn't make contact
takes the pad backward of square on the leg side
defended into the covers, Chanderpaul thinks about a single but Rampaul shouts "no" before there's any danger
whipped off his body to fine leg and Chanderpaul farms the strike this time
full and in at Chanderpaul's toes, turned to midwicket
outside off stump, leans forward with bat and pad together
turned easily into the leg side
picks the vacant gap at square leg for an easy single
rides the extra bounce well, works it to the square leg area
watchfully defended
gets behind the line and Plunkett decides to move to around the wicket
forces a play and miss from Rampaul outside off stump
the stand is broken as Rampaul gets a leading edge against Plunkett trying to work through the leg side and sends a high catch to Stuart Broad at mid off...England a wicket away now
nicely bowled, outside off stump and Chanderpaul doesn't connect with his drive
squared up and the ball goes into the off side
runs the ball to third man so manages to keep the strike
wide outside off stump, Chanderpaul tries to sweep but fails
thuds into the pad and lobs into the leg side
defended to the off
driven to short cover...this is too much even for Chanderpaul
punched to long on, leaves Fidel with one ball
Edwards produces a textbook defensive shot
chopped down to third man and decides against the single
blocked into the off side
driven handsomely to long off, the first thought is two but Plunkett's strong arm keeps them to one and exposes Edwards
well bowled, in the channel and Edwards just about pulls his bat inside the line
worked to square leg, Edwards sets off but there isn't one on offer
left outside off stump
cut hard to backward point
whipped to midwicket, can't find the gap
comes forward and defends carefully
bobbles into the leg side, but not doing much for West Indies' score
turned to midwicket, five dot balls so far
the field came up and Chanderpaul heaves past mid on to reach his fifty off 95 deliveries as his prolific tour continues...it's just a shame about his team-mates
worked past square leg so Chanderpaul gets the strike back
driven to long off and eventually the single is turned down
pushed into the covers, there's a run available but it's turned down again
goes for the pull but doesn't middle it, Anderson dives at mid on although Chanderpaul gets the single
goes for an expansive drive, somehow finds square leg
Edwards gets solidly behind the line and defends to cover
played towards mid off
driven to backward point, Bell pulls off a fine diving save which means Edwards is exposed again
a bouncer from the England captain, and Edwards goes comfortably underneath
and another...does Collingwood think he's a fast bowler or is he repaying Edwards for earlier?

what a farcical way to finish...Edwards swings over James Anderson at midwicket, completes one and begins to race back for a second, but Chanderpaul doesn't want it and Edwards has no chance of getting back as Collingwood collects the throw and breaks the stumps.
